alert.note: Alert for Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 3:42PM MDT until September 26 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Socorro county, including the community of Socorro itself and surrounding locations. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Socorro, Escondida, Lemitar and Chamizal. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 135 and 138. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 145 and 161. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/emergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
